item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Kate Chopin
item.description: "Perhaps it is better to wake up after all, even to suffer, rather than to remain a dupe to illusions all one's life." -- Kate Chopin

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Sarah Orne Jewett
item.description: "In the life of each of us, I said to myself, there is a place remote and islanded, and given to endless regret or secret happiness; we are each the uncompanioned hermit and recluse of an hour or a day; we understand our fellows of the cell to whatever age of history they may belong." -- Sarah Orne Jewett

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Theodore Dreiser
item.description: "People in general attach too much importance to words. They are under the illusion that talking effects great results. As a matter of fact, words are, as a rule, the shallowest portion of all the argument. They but dimly represent the great surging feelings and desires which lie behind. When the distraction of the tongue is removed, the heart listens." -- Theodore Dreiser

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Max Brooks
item.description: "The dead walk among us." -- Max Brooks

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Is it advisable to spread out all the conveniences of culture before people to whom a few steps up a stair to a library is a sufficient deterrent from reading?" -- Ayn Rand

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "Education is experience, and the essence of experience is self-reliance." -- T.H. White

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "No matter who you are, no matter where you live, and no matter how many people are chasing you, what you don't read is often as important as what you do read." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "Ah, good conversation - there's nothing like it, is there? The air of ideas is the only air worth breathing." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by John Greenleaf Whittier
item.description: "Of all sad words of tongue or pen, the saddest are these, 'It might have been." -- John Greenleaf Whittier

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Let others pride themselves about how many pages they have written; I'd rather boast about the ones I've read." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows." -- Horace Mann

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It is a great thing to start life with a small number of really good books which are your very own." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Elizabeth Kostovia
item.description: "When you handle books all day long, every new one is a friend and a temptation." -- Elizabeth Kostovia

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Wilkie Collins
item.description: "Our words are giants when they do us an injury, and dwarfs when they do us a service." -- Wilkie Collins

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books. Books make sense of life. The only problem is that the lives they make sense of are other people's lives, never your own." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "We're all going to die, all of us, what a circus! That alone should make us love each other but it doesn't. We are terrorized and flattened by trivialities, we are eaten up by nothing." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "there are worse things than being alone but it often takes decades to realize this and most often when you do it's too late and there's nothing worse than too late" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The one you love and the one who loves you are never, ever the same person." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are the perfect entertainment: no commercials, no batteries, hours of enjoyment for each dollar spent. What I wonder is why everybody doesn't carry a book around for those inevitable dead spots in life." -- Stephen King

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "The most important thing we learn at school is the fact that the most important things can't be learned at school." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by haruki murakami
item.description: "Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional." -- haruki murakami

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: amandarocks add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot
